subtitle: How to say it, and mean it
description: How to say it, and mean it
title: Saying no to sex
content:
Nobody is allowed to make you have sex. But when someone really wants to have sex with you, they will say many things to get you to agree. 
Try these answers… 

 
Person:		Aren’t you attracted to me?

You:		       Yes, but I respect you too.
                       Yes but I want to get to know you better 

Person:		My friends think we should have done it by now

You:		       They don’t know what’s best for us 
                       You should care more about what I think - and I don’t agree!

Person:		We don’t need to use a condom

You:		       I’m not ready to have a baby 
                       I don’t want to risk catching an infection

Person:		Let’s just do it! 

You:		       If we wait until we’re ready, it’ll be much better

Person:		You would do it with me if you really loved me

You:		       It’s because I love you that I want to wait If you really loved me, you wouldn’t say that

Person:		If we don’t do it soon, I’ll explode!

You:		       Perhaps masturbation will ease that problem! 
                      Then you can relax and take your time with me

Person:		But you’re 16!
You:		       Just because it’s legal, doesn’t mean I have to I’ll decide when I feel ready - and I’m not ready yet

**Practice saying these words out loud…** 

 - No, I’m not ready! 
 - No, I don’t want to!  
 - No, it doesn’t feel right! 

**Boys, remember if a girl says ‘no’, it’s ‘no’! And girls, remember it is your right to say ‘no’! You may just need to learn to say it loud enough...**
